name: Tomato Sev
history: Sev is a popular Indian snack known for its crispy texture. Tomato Sev is a variation that infuses the tangy flavor of tomatoes into the traditional sev recipe.
description: A crispy, tangy, and spicy snack made from gram flour infused with tomato puree, spices, and fried until golden and crunchy.

equipment.name: Sev Maker or a Large-Holed Sieve

instructions.title: Prepare Tomato Puree
instructions.description: Blend the tomato to a smooth puree.

instructions.title: Make Dough
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix gram flour, tomato puree, chili powder, turmeric, asafoetida, and salt. Add water if necessary to form a soft dough.

instructions.title: Heat Oil
instructions.description: Heat oil in a deep frying pan.

instructions.title: Form Sev
instructions.description: Fill the sev maker with dough and press it into hot oil, forming small strands. Fry until crisp and golden.

instructions.title: Drain and Cool
instructions.description: Remove the sev from oil and drain on absorbent paper. Allow it to cool before serving.

tips: Ensure the oil is hot enough before frying the sev for a crispy texture.
Do not overcrowd the pan while frying.
variations: Add garlic paste for a different flavor.
Include a pinch of carom seeds (ajwain) for added taste and digestion benefits.

storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container at room temperature.

presentationTips: Serve in a colorful bowl with a side of mint chutney.
Garnish with chopped coriander for a fresh look.
